text:
What's up, everybody?
Pearce here for "For The Win."

I don't know about you,
but I love football.

And NFL Flag Football
is a great way to get outdoors,

learn how to play the game,
and bonus,

make some new friends.
Let's check it out.

You know the number one reason
families and kids love flag?

It's because it's fun.
With twists and turns,

great catches,
lots of laughter,

and your best friends cheering
on the sidelines.

Kids of all abilities and sizes
can learn how to play,
and everyone has a blast.

It's also a noncontact sport
so nobody gets tackled.

Instead you just have to grab
a flag off the other player.
It's really easy to learn.

You can find NFL FLAG leagues
across the entire country

that are available for boys,
girls, and coed teams.

Which basically just means
all kids together.

They're also different age
groups starting from age four,

going all the way up
to 17 years old.

So you get to play
with kids your own age.
I love it!

Another cool thing
about flag football

is that it is also
a great team sport

that teaches you how
to be a leader
and how to become a good sport.

Which are handy things
to help you grow
and do awesome things in life.

NFL FLAG leagues give every
person a chance to have

a fun game and plenty
of time on the field.

It's also the largest
flag football league in the US.

And the only league
where kids get to wear

the official NFL gear
when they play.

Basically, it's you
and your friends

playing a super fun game,
enjoying the outdoors,

and learning some great life
skills along the way.

And, bonus!
You can play all year round.
Well sign me up!

To learn more and find
a league near you,

grab a grown-up
and visit NFLFLAG.com.
